intro: Boninofatsia wilsonii, commonly known as the Bonin fatshrub, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique species from threats such as invasive species and habitat loss.
